title: Only friends (3/7)  [Peter Parker x Reader]
body:
Summary: Peter Parker was many things, but Y/N didn’t expected him to be the love of her life (fluff)

Words: 590 +/- (this one is pretty short, sorry)

Warnings: none

*Prologue* *Part 1* *Part 2* *Part 4*  *Part 5*  *Part 6*

Peter Parker liked fanfics.

But maybe it was my fault.

He spent a lot of time behind the computer screen. Reading a thousand stories about all the shows we watched. 

I was a pretty good writer. I had surrendered to the fanfic world a few months ago, it was my way to relax. I had fun with high school fanfics because I saw myself in all of those failed students.

Peter kept his eyes on the little screen and sometimes giggled, so I concluded that:  a) he was watching cute videos of kittens, b) watching cute videos of dogs or c) reading some fanfic. He stopped reading suddenly and jumped up from the chair, looking at me with a funny face, as if he had discovered something incredible.

“You said you didn’t know a way to escape Flash without hurting him, right?” I nodded, dropping my cell phone on my side to pay attention to him. “I know a way out! How could I not have thought of this before?”

“On what?”

"You can get someone to pretend to date you.” I raised an eyebrow, wondering if he was serious.

“And how am I going to do that? I can’t just get into a person and say “hi, do you want to pretend to be my boyfriend?”. This is not going to happen, because of kissing, hugging and holding hands, I wouldn’t feel comfortable doing this with someone just by pretending.“ He just nodded quietly and stood silently staring at me, as if searching for an answer to that unsolvable problem.

I knew the easiest solution would be for me to tell the truth at once to Flash, but I was too scared about hurting him.

“I can pretend to be your boyfriend.”

"Wh-what?” I asked discredited.

“Hold hands, hug, call cute nicknames … It’s not so different from what we do, after all. You feel comfortable doing these things with me, don’t you?” I acquiesced. “So it’s the perfect solution. People already think we have something, anyway. It wouldn’t be so difficult to convince them, and also, Ned would stop asking every week if we have something.”

“But he only asked twice …”

“To you. I’ve lost count of how many times he asked me, "Have you and Y/N ever even gotten a small kiss?” Honestly, I think he likes you.”

“You’re crazy. Ned doesn’t like me.” Peter shrugged. “Hmm, I’m not sure about this fake dating … What if we kiss and things get weird later?” He said nothing, just got up from his chair and threw himself on the bed beside me, making me stare at him. I narrowed my eyes as he came and touched his lips to mine. As much as we exchanged caresses, we had never come to this kind of intimacy. I felt my cheeks warm with embarrassment and that made me want to run away.

“Are you feeling anything for me?” I stared at him and denied it. “Do you think anything will change after that kiss?” I denied it again, seeing him smile. “This can bring us many benefits too, as for example, we won’t need to call anyone to the prom, and no one will stand on our feet insisting. It’s only three months before we finish high school, it’s not that long. I think we can fake it, right?

“With a condition.” I said, making he squeeze his eyes in my direction. "That you buy me a cookie every day.” Peter laughed and nodded.

I was getting myself into a big trouble.

Taglist: @tokoyamisstuff, @imrllybored, @xxxxdelenaxxxx, @saturnspiderman

send me an ask or message if you want to be on my taglist and which character you want (Bucky, Peter, Avengers, all of them…)

leave a comment on this post if you’d like to be tagged ONLY in this fic series

A/N: I really want a cookie right now, anyways, let me know if you guys are liking it.

tags: spider man into the spider verse
amazing spiderman spiderman peter parker marvel meme funny
summary: This is astounding! Am I a spider with the limitations of a pig? Or a pig with the proportionate strength and agility of a...
body:
This is astounding! Am I a spider with the limitations of a pig? Or a pig with the proportionate strength and agility of a spider? I’ve become something greater than either spider or pig… I’ve become a Spider-Ham!

Peter Porker, the Spectacular Spider-Ham#15 (May 1987)

reblog.comment:
